lines.text: You're a small and lonely man, Murphy. Like me. The world will never build us a monument. The difference is I know that.
Lady! I'm stark bollocks naked!
You won't be beautiful for a while, but around here it won't make any difference.
Where the f... am I?
Somewhere where we try to avoid that kind of language, Mr Murphy.
Turn around!
Do you not have a gentleman doctor?
Turn around!
Yes Sir.
Man is only truly alive when he confronts death.
He can also be truly dead.

[to the lady doctor]
Mornin' Sir.

[as the doctor is about to stick a needle into him]
I hope you sharpened it this time.
Didn't you hear them? The war is over!
Their war. Not mine!
There's nothin' wrong with my f... language!
Relax? How can I relax with that bunch gawkin' at me?
That bunch as you call them have never seen a naked white man.
Ah! Well, they've had their thrill for the day. Would ya tell 'em to f... leave immediately.
You were in a coma. It was probably an alligator.
This alligator had guns stickin' from its nostrils!
Nothin' heroic, me old son. It came natural. I was only savin' me own skin. The name's Murphy.
Louis, the doctor lady... she's a Quaker. That's like bein' a bloody nun, isn't it?
No, I don't think so.
Why couldn't she be any young nurse? Something practical!
There's nothing wrong with my f... language!
Relax? How can I relax with that bunch gawking at me?
That bunch as you call them have never seen a naked white man.
Ah! Well, they've had their thrill for the day. Would you tell them to f... leave immediately?
You were in a coma. It was probably an alligator.
This alligator had guns sticking from its nostrils!
Louis, the doctor lady... she's a Quaker. That's like being a bloody nun, isn't it?
No, I don't think so.
Why couldn't she be a young nurse? Something practical!
